item.title: A Plea for Lean Software by Niklaus Wirth (1995)
item.description: Plea for Greek Independence by Eugène Delacroix (1826) In 1889, Anton Chekhov writes to his brother Alexander: “My advice: in the play try to be original and as clever as possible, but do not be afraid to seem silly; we need free-thinking, but only the freethinker who is not afraid to write nonsense. Do not grind it, but be clumsy and impudent. Brevity is the soul of wit.” I think we can apply the same principles to academic papers as well.
